intro: Bupleurum subovatum f. genuinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal gardens.
